result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert M Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Robert M Williams in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Law intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Rumpf makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
120 Days without work release.  (Credit - 1 day).  
Term of Probation: 1 Year transferred to Milwaukee County. 
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Condition Time: 30 days huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion

Defendant Robert M Williams in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Attorney appears as friend of the court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Masnica requests to dismiss the complaint unless the State orally amends the complaint.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. State moves to amend complaint orally to Obstructing Officer. Court finds there is sufficent basis in the criminal complaint for obstructing officer.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
